fields.description:
Just turning up a fresh install.
 
The issue fields seem to be in some unhappy state.
 
When I try to edit the 'Environment' field to say something else in the description field, I get: 
 
2004-02-20 23:32:18,157 ERROR [webwork.dispatcher.ServletDispatcher] Could not execute action
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: 10, Size: 10

As an expirement, I tried to edit the 'assignto' field to be described as 'assignto'.  What results, is I now have two 'Environment' entries, the first is the normal one, the second (new) one has 'assignto' as its description.
fields.summary: Cannot edit 'Environment' issue field on fresh install
need ability to have user with no email address

fields.description: It would be great if I could write a rule such as "when an issue has 10 votes raise it to Major priority," or perhaps even some kind of relative weighting (eg., "when an issue reaches the top 10% vote score raise it to priority Major").
fields.summary: Rules triggered on voting

fields.description:
we entered this string into the description field and it housed up the app. by wrapping it with
tags it worked ok. 
hr=001/255,194,115&hd=001/245,226,203&ey=001/245,226,203&fc=001/245,226,203&bd=001/245,226,203&lh=001/245,226,203&rh=001/245
if you enter the above string of text WITHOUT the 
tags it barfs it up big time.
fields.summary: This string of code causes MAJOR problems when entered into the description field.
Refactor issue type

fields.description: When I'm done editing an issue, I'd like to automatically return to my previous view. For instance, I often run a query (filter) for a particular set of issues. I usually open each issue (for instance, re-assignment or estimation), make a change... and then find myself back at the issue detail. I'd rather be back on my directory of issues so I can move right on to the next one... (I know, it sounds trivial, but when you do this repetitively and have mild carpel tunnel syndrome, it really does matter).
fields.summary: Automaticly return to issue summary

fields.description:
One of the requirements in our project is that all issues need to be estimated. Accordingly, there are two things I would like to be able to do:

1. Create a filter for "Tasks Needing Estimates" so that users can login and periodically look at tasks assigned to them that still require an estimate. Then they could quickly click through each and assign the time estimate.

2. Ability to set a few rules regarding time estimates, the most important of which is, developers cannot start work on a project until the estimate has been filled in.
fields.summary: View issues without an estimate

fields.description:
If I click on a view issue URL, for example:

http://.../jira/browse/JIRA-16

and am not logged in, Jira asks me to login.  But once I login it no longer remembers that I wanted to view the issue and goes to the project page instead.
fields.summary: URL not remembered past login

fields.summary: Subscription Email Problems

fields.description:
You have a good selection of display styles for issues (eg. Browser, Printable, etc), but they all use the same set of columns.

I would very, very much like to have a "wide" and "narrow" set of column layouts. Or perhaps "full" and "summary."

Basically, I'd like one view where, at the click of a single button, I can switch between two different column layouts. I tend to do different things at different times. Sometimes I'm looking at the overall time-commitment of people. In this case I'd like to see the due date, estimate, current progress. At other times, I'm looking at the issues themselves, I'm more concerned with the summary, issue type, status, etc.

But, if I turn on all these columns they are just way to small. So I can't easily see everything I want at one time (and I'd rather not see all that information at one time anyhow).

If users had two different column layouts that could switch between it would be a great solution to this problem.
fields.summary: Would love a wide and narrow view of issues.

fields.description:
From the mailing list

I tracked this down, it's due to a missing email field type in the
fieldtype-mssql.xml file.  I added the following, copied from the MySQL
configuration and it seems to solve the problem:
 
<field-type-def type="email" sql-type="VARCHAR(255)"
java-type="String"><validate name="isEmail" /></field-type-def>
 
I also noticed that there are other "Specialized Types" listed in the MySQL
field types that do not exist in the MS SQL file -- are these going to cause
other problems later?
 
-Mark
fields.summary: Missing declarations in field types

fields.description: If you view the all tab of an Issue you get a error message.
fields.summary: All tab on issue shows an error on jira.atlassian.com

fields.description:
E-mails with no text/plain but only a html version of the content are not processed by Create Issue / Comment Handler.

We have many customers, who are accustomed to open calls by emails using any e-mail client in any configuration. So we have no control, that everyone configure his e-mail client to send the content also as text/plain.
fields.summary: No creation of issues/comment by e-mails with no text/plain, but only html version of the content

fields.description: If we have a restricted project in JIRA it doesn't make sense to ping various URLs we enter into issue descriptions. However we'd like trackbacks to be shown in our confluence space. So, some way to restrict trackback site is required. Simple regexp will be enough.
fields.summary: Add ability to filter sites, to send trackbacks to

fields.description:
We need to notify the reporter when her issue moves to another project.
 
We expected, adding the reporter to the receivers of create issue notifications in the notification scheme associated with the destination project would be sufficient. But it seems, that the move action does not fire a create event - and also no other event received by event listeners.
fields.summary: Move Issue should (optional) trigger create issue event

fields.description:
When you browse issues and selects one of them, you will see the details of the issue and the comments. The "work log" is not shown. 

Would it be possible to visualize that there are actually something written in the "work log"? For example a (*) or some color highlighting.

The reason is that many of our issues work logs are empty, but some are not.
fields.summary: UI improvement: give a hint about "work log" being used

fields.description:
Here is the procedure I must follow when creating a new JIRA project:
* Add new users (if there are any new).
* Create 2 user groups:
** projectX-administrators
** projectX-developers
* For each user add them to the correct groups (either administrator or developer or both).
* Create a new permission scheme.
* Modify the permissions in the permission scheme so that the two new groups have access to various actions.
* Create projectX.
* Associate the new permission scheme with projectX.

Huhh

It would be very nice if all of these operations could be made from a SOAP interface. Then we could write a GUI tool that would allow easy setup of new projects (with groups, correct permissions and all).

An alternative would be to have more Jelly tags to support the operations.
fields.summary: SOAP interface for project and user management

fields.description:
ViewCVS can display more than 1 repository. To make a diff between more repositories, viewCVS appends a query-string to the url: ?cvsroot=[nameOfTheRepository]

Jira doensn't support this, so viewCVS takes the default one.
fields.summary: more repositories in viewCVS

fields.description:
What about adding new statuses?
eg. to recognize that developer has read/accept but not start to solve an issue it's useful to have addional statuses.

Regards
Andreas Woerner
SysTek Informationsysteme GmbH
fields.summary: Add new statuses

fields.description: Bugzilla allows you to declare that one issue depends on another.  JIRA should preserve this information, perhaps with a custom issue link type, and links between dependent issues.
fields.summary: Bugzilla importer should preserve inter-issue dependencies

fields.description:
> Because of changes in our network enviroment, JIRA
> was not able to connect to the Mail Server.
> 
> We fixed the problem and JIRA is now able
> connect to the mail server - sending e-mails
> with the "send testmail" runs perfectly.
> 
> But ....
> 
> .. JIRA still queues the mail - no sends
> .. and "Flush mail queue" does not Flush the Queue
> 
> Additional information:
> - no entries in the Error Queue
> - Mail Queue Service delay is set to 1min.
fields.summary: Network outage causes mail queue to break

fields.description:
Create 1 security levels
Put some issues into it
Delete the level (hence removing any security level from the issues)
You will not be able to find the issues any more - need to re-index
fields.summary: When deleting an Issue Security Level issues need to be re-indexed

fields.description: It would be fantastic if JIRA would time work while an issue is being worked on (between pressing Start Progress and Stop Progress). It would have to "sleep" during off hours, which implies a working calendar (eg, M-F from 9 to 5), and users would need an "I'm on vacation" setting so that they could easily suspend work without having to Stop Progress on every issue. Ideally, developers could have personal calendars and an optional ability to overwrite the recorded work time could be available in a permission (so that an Administrator would have the ability to fix mistakes). This is something several of our developers have asked for and as a project manager, it's absolutely my #1 priority feature request.
fields.summary: Would like option for JIRA to automatically time work done

fields.description:
I just upgraded from  
   Professional Edition, Version: 2.3 #53
To 
  Professional Edition, Version: 2.5.3 #59
 
Environment: 
Win 2000 Server IIS 5 
Apache Tomcat/4.1.24 
SQL Server 2000 
 
and there seems to be some database changes/errors. (see log file below)

 I have changed my entityengine.xml for the datasource field-type-name to use mssql:
 
 <datasource name="defaultDS" field-type-name="mssql"
      helper-class="org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO"
      check-on-start="true"
      use-foreign-keys="false"
      use-foreign-key-indices="false"
      check-fks-on-start="false"
      check-fk-indices-on-start="false"
      add-missing-on-start="true">
        <jndi-jdbc jndi-server-name="default" jndi-name="java:comp/env/jdbc/JiraDS"/>
    </datasource>
    
    
Here is the contents of my log file:

fields.description:
We need to be able to disable - ie not show the link for - Attach Screenshot - otherwise we wont be able to upgrade to 2.6.

In particular, the auto-loading of the JRE for the Attach ScreenShot Applet could cause problems with existing applications that depend on the Microsoft VM. Its too big a risk to take.

There are other issues to do with signing of the applet, the version of JRE - and if they are not resolved before 2.6 release, then it will become necessary for a number of corporate users, I suspect.
fields.summary: Must be able to "disable" (not display link for) Attach screenshot

fields.description:

See linked issue for more information.

Related to JRA-2730
Perhapse driven by permissions so you could set it up so that admins could see voters, but users couldn't.

fields.description:
When you append '?jira_profile=on' to the JIRA URL, the issue navigator fails to display any of the columns defined in the default issue navigator setup.

Trying to restore defaults has no effect.

This is with a multi-project database and customized fields for individual projects displayed in the issue navigator.

fields.description:
If I do a search for "NotSerializableException", I get zero matching issues.

If I do a search for "java.io.NotSerializableException", I get 1 issue : JRA-1909

Are '.'s treated as whitespace for indexing?
fields.summary: Search returns no results for Java classnames

fields.description: The new osuser library used in jira 2.6 has changed module definitions and everything no longer is in com.opensymphony.module.user.* but in com.opensymphony.user.*.  This affects, for example, the information which needs to be put in osuser.xml to enable ldap integration.
fields.summary: ldap integration incorrect for 2.6

fields.description:
the User class contains a reference (via its superclass Entity) that eventually leads to the singleton UserManager, and from there to the various osuser providers.  because not all of these classes implement java.io.Serializable, you eventually get NotSerializableExceptions when you try to serialize a User instance.

this happens (writing a User instance) in at least one place that I'm aware of: the "default authenticator" used by JIRA.

there are obvious performance and resource usage implications here.

one possible short-term fix would be to not try to write the User instance to the session, but write some sort of identifier instead.  the long term fix will have to invlolve osuser.
fields.summary: User instance serialization writes the world

fields.description:
Can we have a feature that will allow users to edit comments? Also when a comment is edited have it mark who edited the comment. 

Thanks
Mike
fields.summary: Editing of comments

During this I found it quite cumbersome to create a new group (e.g.
"customers") and add multiple users to this group. I had to go to each
user and add him...very cumbersome for more than a few users ;(
 
Would be great with something like a "bulk/quick-assoicate users" feature.

fields.description: When clicking on 'Attach Screenshot', I get the popup window and grey square appears.  After a couple of seconds the grey box goes white, but I don't see any more on the window.  I can't seem to paste screenshots in by Ctrl-V either...

fields.description:
It is convenient to copy links out of JIRA and use them in other web pages (e.g. a Wiki), as a quick entry into some relevant bit of status.  A saved query link can be copied out, but unless the user is currently logged in (i.e. has a cookie in the current browser session) then a link like:

http://jira.server.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true?sorter/field=priority&resolutionIds=-1&pid=10002&fixfor=10043

(or even http://username@jira.server.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true?sorter/field=priority&resolutionIds=-1&pid=10002&fixfor=10043)

generates an error like:

HTTP Status 500 - You do not have the permissions to browse this project<p><small><small><pre>com.atlassian.jira.exception.PermissionException: You do not have the permissions to browse this project at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.IssueActionSupport.getSelectedProject(IssueActionSupport.java:95) at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.IssueNavigator.getPid(IssueNavigator.java:425) at ... (for several pages.)

It would be nice if it could prompt for login and then forward to the originally requested page.
fields.summary: Saved JIRA Links to IssueNavigator do not prompt for login

Currently it has links to support@atlassian - and we want it to refer to our own internal support contacts.

We *could* just hack the JSP - but it would be nice if there was a better way...

fields.description: Add thumbnail images of image attachments. Thumbnail images can then be viewed in issue navigator in a new column.
fields.summary: Add thumbnail images of image attachments

fields.description:
Please add the ability to import/export 'projects only' from JIRA.

Why? To archive projects that only require lookup for historical reasons.
Now you have to export everything and delete the project. When looking up the finished project, the whole exported environment will overwrite the current environment, thus requiring an additional instance of JIRA.
fields.summary: Option to import/export Single Projects from JIRA.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3166].
  {panel}

Over a period of time our data inside JIRA grew larger and larger and with each new version, this data was exported out of the old version and imported in the new version.

JIRA currently reports a lot of database warnings, but it is never repaired.

My request is a tool which checks the consistency of the data and let you optionally fix the various problems, so the data is aligned with the latest JIRA version; allowing the choice to remove/keep additions made, references to fix, etc.

Note that I haven't checked into the origin of the warnings, but we keep having problems with importing this data in JIRA.
fields.summary: Database consistency check tool

fields.description:
1. USE CASE:
Create a new issue.
Select due date from calendar popup.
Selected due date is in between 1.Mar.2004 and 31.Mar.2004.

PROBLEM:
Issue cannot be saved. (No exception).

2. USE CASE:
Create new issue.
Select an accepted date and save the issue.
Then edit the issue again and try the due date specified above.

PROBLEM:
Exception is thrown: You did not enter a valid date. Please enter the date in the format "d-MMM-yyyy".
fields.summary: Due date is invalid when >= 1.Mar.2004 and <= 31.Mar.2004

fields.description:
We migrated a lot, due to failure to get JIRA to work in combinations.
As long as there is a backup, there is no problem. Each time, although, we force ourself to remember to also add the attachments to the backup.

Why can't the backup sceduler include the attachments? We see this as a major drawback in the backup design.

However, it completely ignores this directory - and instead uses the index directory from the imported data (which is completely wrong in most cases..)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3157].
{panel}
We have many Jira Administrators - at least one per project.
 In a way, this is due to a missing level of administration (JRA-3156) - but regardless of that fact, its necessary to know which administrator did what & when - we need to have an audit trail of Administrator actions. In some cases, we need to have notifications - or have additional information in existing notifications detail who the administrator was that performed this action.

Currently, the problems we have experienced are:
 # (/) (done as of 7.5.0, see example [^screenshot-1.png]) A user is created, but we dont know by who. Sometimes, we see a user that isnt meant to exist e.g. "testUser" - but we dont know who to contact to get rid of it.
 Sometimes the user themselves have a problem logging on, getting access to their project etc - and it would be useful for them to contact the administrator that created their account rather - therefore it would be useful to have this info in an audit trail, so we can find out who it is - or better still, have this information in the email sent out (JRA-2555)
 # (/) (done) A default notification scheme is changed - affecting all projects - and we dont know who did it (we want to know who did it so we can ask them not to do that again)
 # (/) (done) A global custom field is added (usually by mistake) - affecting all projects - and we dont know who did it (We want to know who did it so we can remove it - and ask them not to do that again)
 # (/) (done as of 7.10) A new issue type is added - affecting all projects - and we dont know who did it (we want to know who did it so we can discuss using an existing issue type - or discuss the addition of a new type so that it makes sense to more projects)
 # (/) (done) A user we dont know about is given jira-administrator priveledges. Given the fact that this new user may not know very much about how to administer Jira - and they can go on to do the things mentioned above, then we need to know about this. We need to contact the administrator who did it and ask them not to do it again. We need to contact the new jira-administrator and make sure they know what they are doing!
 # (/) (done as of 7.10) Someone turns unnassigned issues "on" and all of a sudden Project Leads stop getting notifications for new issues on their project. We need to know who did it, so we can break their legs .

These have been the main ones that have bitten us.
fields.summary: JIRA Administration Audit trail / notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3156].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 6 July 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks again for all your votes and comments on this suggestion.

In JIRA platform 7.3, we allowed project administrators to edit their project's workflows under specific conditions. Now, we're happy to announce that with JIRA 7.4, we added more fine-grained control to the Administer Projects permission, and added a few more perks for the project administrator. When granted, the Extended project administration permission will allow project administrators for the associated projects to edit the project's workflows and screens.

You can learn more about it here: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjira/jira-platform-releases/jira-7-4-x-platform-release-notes]

As the next step, we’d like to hear your feedback about these new capabilities, and the most important features you’d like to see in the Project Level Administration moving forward.

For this purpose, we've created a new suggestion focused entirely on collecting feedback and ideas for further improvements: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-65574. We’ll use it to keep engaging with you on this topic, so please drop all your thoughts there.

To avoid having multiple suggestions about the same topic, we’re closing this one as fixed. It doesn’t mean that no further work will be done in this area, quite the opposite actually. This will help us streamline your feedback and identify some missing parts that we still need to incorporate into JIRA.

Thanks,
Jakub Lazinski
Product Manager, JIRA Server
{panel}
*Original request description:*

As a JIRA Administrator I find it more difficult to manage JIRA configuration as my organisation grows. I need to be able to share some of my administrative powers with other people, but I do not want to give them all the management rights, because I am afraid they are going to break things. Each of the projects run in JIRA has its own manager and it would be best if I could give the configuration permissions related to the projects to the respective project managers.
fields.summary: Add additional administrative privileges to users with Administer Projects permission

fields.description:
Under some conditions, I still get URLS like http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=JRA-2555 from search results - rather than http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-2555.

I say some conditions - this is because I cant repeatably get this behaviour. It seems that this comes and goes....
fields.summary: Pretty URL's seem to go AWOL occasionally...

fields.description:
One of the common things that you want to do from an audit perspective is see what projects a user has access to.

The workflow usually is:
1) Search for a user
2) Display groups a user is a member of
3) Find out what permission schemes each group is used in
4) Find out what projects the permission schemes refer to.

When you display the list of groups a user is a member of, you want the listed groups to be URL's so that you can click on them and go to a "ViewGroup" page - that has a list of what permission schemes that group is used in - or better still, a list of Projects (via Permission scheme) as well.

-Nick
fields.summary: ViewUser shows a list of groups - the group list should be URL's

fields.description:
Related to JRA-2320:

In addition to permission scheme, you want to see where else a group is used before deleting it.

You want to know if its being used in:
a) A notification scheme
b) A saved filter
c) A filter sharing

Perhaps there are some other places a group is used?
fields.summary: View what notification schemes / saved filter / a group is used in

fields.description:
Not sure if an issue already exists for this - I couldnt find it. It came up in conversation with Mike/Jeff.

We are getting the "Detected you are using Tomcat. Turned off transactions" error message - running in Websphere 5.0.2.1.....

Apparently its due to Tomcat and Websphere using Jasper - and Jira uses the Sitemesh util - which detects Jasper - and therefore wrongly assumes its Tomcat.

Attached is an image of the result when trying to view the issue and the consolelog from BEA.

fields.description:
We at catWorkX still us a separate time tracking system as Jira currently doesn´t cover all the functionallity we really need.

I tried to get an overview on already posted issues concerning this topic to check if everything we need is mentioned already. It would be very helpfull to have a separated component within the jira project to see all the time tracking issues on a glance.

Cheers

Wolfgang
fields.summary: time tracking as a component of the JIRA project

fields.description: In the "view issue" page, the "Manage Links" link is broken, if the /browse/* URL is used.  This is because the JSP assumes itself relative to /secure/, and just appends "ManageLinks.jspa".
fields.summary: Manage Links link broken

fields.description:
I have a JIRA 2.5.2 Pro installation that runs on JBoss 3.2.1. I've set it up so that it uses usernames and passwords from our LDAP server. This works fine. 

But in the log files for JBoss I can find all the passwords for all the users that has logged in to JIRA ($LOCAL_DIR/jboss-3.2.1_tomcat-4.1.24/server/default/log/server.log)!

This is an example (I've scrambled this):

2004-02-14 15:25:00,580 INFO  [STDOUT] 12 34 00 4b 00 49 6f 73 5f 75 73 65 72 6e 61 6d  | .4.K.Ios_usernam
2004-02-14 15:25:00,580 INFO  [STDOUT] 6f 3f 7f 6f 7f 6f 6f 2f 6f 7f 5f 7f 6f 3f 3f 3f  | e=USER&os_passw
2004-02-14 15:25:00,580 INFO  [STDOUT] 6f 7f 6f 3f 6f 6f 6f 6f 6f 3f 3f 3f 3f 3f 3f 3f  | ord=PASSWORD&os_

Notice also that hex output (also scrambled).

I don't know if this is a bug with JBOss or JIRA.
fields.summary: Security risk - passwords appear in the log file

fields.description: You need to get a proper certificate for the applet - or else there will be some disquiet amongst some corporate users - and their IT Security overlords.
fields.summary: Applet certificate is not trusted.

fields.description:
In version 2.3, Jira gave some useful messages as to what it was doing when it was starting up:

"Loading the Statistics for Project X"

Currently, in v2.5.3, it is completely silent, and from an administrators perspective, there is no clue as to what is going on - if there is any progress. How fast is it loading?

If you have a large database (65 projects, 8000 issues, 600 users) then it takes ages to start - and the feedback in the form of logging is very useful.

-Nick
fields.summary: Jira needs to have some Startup feedback...

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3141].
  {panel}

When I look at the database contents, the paths for the indexes, backups and attachments are stored in the tables (in PROPERTYSTRING). This couples the database contents with the application server, which violates encapsulation -- the database now has a reverse dependency on the configuration details of the application server. This has the very practical implications that moving to a new machine or deployment directory for the application server requires some [afaik undocumented] monkeying around with the paths stored in the database.

(a) If the information pertains to the paths into which the application server is deployed, it should be in the XML configuration descriptors in the webapp.

(b) Attachments are pretty important information anyway, so they should really be in the database. See issue JRA-806.

(c) It would be lovely if the indexes were also stored in the database. (This is possible using Lucene, right?) But it would be an ok solution too if they were stored with the app server -- but only if the relevant path was in the *app server* config, and they were regenerated as needed.
fields.summary: Decouple database and app server

fields.description: Try issue editing e.g.
fields.summary: Cancel button is not working under Firefox 8.0
Add more support for 'part of/consist of' relation

fields.description:
Currently, if a nonexistent issue is requested via /browse/FOO-1, a regular HTML page is returned with a 200 OK status response.

For the benefit of web crawlers (the 2.6 URL space is now crawler-friendly), we ought to return a 404 "Not Found" status.  The existing HTML page would still returned as the body, so no user-visible difference.

This would also have the advantage of preventing caches caching the error page, if /browse/FOO-1 ever became available.

Similar story with /browse/FOO project URLs.  Currently a nonexistent project redirects to the last valid /browse/ URL.  So after /browse/FOO (where FOO is valid), /browse/BAR (where BAR is invalid) will return exactly the same page, but with the wrong URL.
fields.summary: Response for nonexistent issues and projects should have 404 status
Change the Restrictions to the Entry codes

fields.description: Both the dashboard and the Issue Navigator do not show any priority icons. Resetting the issue navigator columns does not fix the issue.
fields.summary: Priority icons don't show

fields.description:
When an issue field is changed, the text notification contains:

Changes:
          <Field Name> changed from <Old value>

but it doesn't mention what the new value is.  The logic in issueupdated.vm looks rather broken.
fields.summary: Text update email does not show new text

fields.description:
The attachscreenshot.jsp has the applet hardcoded for "application/x-java-applet;jpi-version=1.4.1_01"

My java is current 1.4.2_03. The applet fails to load. By changing the jsp page to reference only "application/x-java-applet", it seems to work fine.
fields.summary: Screenshot applet page is hardcoded for jfe 1.4.1

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3132].
  {panel}

*Original request description:*

There are a number of situations where you want to delete a user - but transfer all of their reported/assigned issues to someone else.

We have a large number of duplicate users - and we also have had some people leave - and we want to delete them.

"Merge Users" is the best description I can think of.
fields.summary: Provide ability to transfer reported/assigned issues to another user when deleting users

fields.description: It would be really useful to be allowed to specify numbers in the project keys. Please really consider this. Having only letters seriously reduce the scalability of the product for companies like ours that have many short lived projects and need to classify them in a nice way. Categories group them, but dont provide meaningful identifiers in the issue numbers
fields.summary: Allow Numbers in Project Keys

fields.description: The filtersubscription.vm velocity template throws a NullPointerException.
fields.summary: Filter Subscription Vleocity template throws a NullPointerException

fields.description: I have to provide open issue by priority statistics and project summary statitics to management for one of our projects. Whereas the stats used to be on the overall project, I now need them on a section of the project. I have created global filters to provide me the raw data, but it would be nice if I could select from my (and/or global) list of filters on the relevant portlets (default would be "none") and have the stats updated.
fields.summary: Would like to be able to optionally attach a filter to the statistics portlets

fields.description:
when there are a large number of issues spanning a large number of dates in Jira, searches using date criteria will fail with the exception:

An error occurred searching: org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery$TooManyClauses

see stack trace below.

The problem is that the date range search query actually turns into a BooleanQuery inside lucene, and if there are more than 1024 different dates, lucene will fail.

What needs to happen is the "Created After" and "Created Before" search criteria need to be combined into a single date range.  Right now, they are individual RangeQueries, causing lucene to try to match every single date on one side or the other of the chosen boundary.

If the user only chooses "Created Before" (for example), and there are more than 1000 possible dates, Jira should present some kind of error message asking for a lower limit.  Or (perhaps better) go as far as it can and report the limit in the search results.

Note that the lucene api allows you to retrieve terms less than a given term - see IndexReader#terms(Term).  It would be possible to use this to determine that too many dates match.

Another solution would be to "normalize" dates in the search index to whole number days only.  Right now it would appear the actual timestamp is indexed and the hours, minutes and seconds are not stripped off.  Stripping these off would reduce the number of indexed terms in the lucene index.  However, after a few years (1024 days, to be exact :) even this will fail - so Jira will still need to do some error checking.

stack trace:

org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery$TooManyClauses
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery.add(BooleanQuery.java:109)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery.add(BooleanQuery.java:101)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.RangeQuery.rewrite(RangeQuery.java:137)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery.rewrite(BooleanQuery.java:244)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.IndexSearcher.rewrite(IndexSearcher.java:188)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.Query.weight(Query.java:120)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.IndexSearcher.search(IndexSearcher.java:128)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.MultiSearcher.search(MultiSearcher.java:150)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.Hits.getMoreDocs(Hits.java:93)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.Hits.<init>(Hits.java:80)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.Searcher.search(Searcher.java:71)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.Searcher.search(Searcher.java:65)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.search(LuceneSearchProvider.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.DefaultSearchProvider.search(DefaultSearchProvider.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.execute(DefaultIssueManager.java:144)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.CachingIssueManager.execute(CachingIssueManager.java:82)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.IssueNavigator.getBrowsableItems(IssueNavigator.java:370)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.IssueNavigator.doExecute(IssueNavigator.java:258)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:154)
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:46)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:131)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraServletDispatcher.service(JiraServletDispatcher.java:181)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:856)
fields.summary: failure finding issues by date criteria: org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery$TooManyClauses

fields.description:
On the group browser page, you have the following text:

"The Group Browser allows you to browse all the groups in the system. You can also add and remove groups from here (you may only remove empty groups)."

Note that you CAN remove groups that are not empty.  In fact, you are given a warning that doing so will not delete the users..
fields.summary: Group
user pager always resets filter

fields.description: Adding a new Custom Field for a project requires Administrator to have Browse Project permission for that particular project. The listbox shows only those projects where the admin has Browse Project permission, it's not enough to have Administer Project permission. In my opinion this is a bit confusing as the administrator *should* have permission to do this kind of thing without explicit Browse Project permission.
fields.summary: Create custom field for project requires BrowseProject permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3123].
  {panel}

We would like to use JIRA to help us to respect our Service Level Agreements (SLA). To do so, it is necessary that we can define actions to be triggered when a certain period of time has been exceeded to do a certain action on an issue, or to change the state of an issue.
For example, we would like to be able to send mail to certain person when an event occur on an issue. this event should be for instance : 
- a time period exceeded before the resolution, a state change or a reply, for every task in a particular project
- the total time passed on an issue exceeded a
 certain amount.
fields.summary: Being able to better control our Service Level Agreements (SLA)

fields.description:
The RSS given my JIRA doesn't validate.

a) the file doesn't start with <?xml.....>

b) there's a comment at the top of the file which breaks XML

c) when forign character sets are used in JIRA, the RSS ends up contained entity references that are not declared

d) date is in the installations locale, not a standard date ( reported for reference, another issue was previously entered, and fixed )

Theres possibly other issues here but these are the ones I've come accross with the JIRA plugin.
fields.summary: Generated RSS doesn't validate

fields.description:
When an issue is created with a '<' [smaller than] sign in the summary, no problems arise. If though the issue is edited, an update results in the following error:

Form Errors: 
Exception occurred: com.atlassian.core.AtlassianCoreException: Error in action: com.atlassian.jira.action.issue.IssueUpdate@2119432, result: null: SQL Exception occurred on commit (I/O-uitzondering: End of TNS data channel)

If the sign is replaced by a textual representation, the first word of the summary is always scrambled like:

që@it possible to use smaller than signs

For:

Is it possible ...
fields.summary: SQL error when editing an issue

fields.description: Various people have requested new types of custom fields.  Joseph Dane has provided some code allowing pluggable custom field types, which we should integrate and use to implement the requested types.
fields.summary: New custom field types

fields.description:
We're doing a lot of imports from bugzilla, and frequently a user will already have an account (with a different email address).  It would be great to be able to merge two users so all the issues and groups get combined into a single user.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Merge users

fields.description:
I had some jira issues with links in a variety of categories (incorporates, duplicates, etc).  When I deleted an issue linked from these bugs, the remaining issues appeared to lose all links in the link category of the deleted issue (in this case, all incoporates links disappeared.)

This persisted until I flushed the issue cache.  No permanent errors.
fields.summary: Deleting a linked issue temporarily removes links on other issues

fields.description: The date field alone to too granular for our needs.  We require the ability to have a custom field that includes the time as well.
fields.summary: No DateTime custom field

fields.description:
People on my team sometimes accidentally assign a bug to the wrong project. This would be less common if we could have an icon graphic for each project, similar to how I can define an icon for each issue type. Graphics stick out better to people than text does when choosing a project to file a bug under.

Request: support assigning an icon-sized graphic to each project. Perhaps ship with a small set of distinctive samples as well for the artistically challenged.
fields.summary: Request: add optional icon for each project

fields.description:
Very simple suggestion:

When creating a new issue, and selecting the "affects versions" field, currently the "unreleased versions" appear first...

In most cases (in 99% of our cases anyway - including creating this issue) issues get reported for versions that are already released... So we usually have to scroll down to "released versions" in order to select the proper version.

If released versions were presented first (in inverse chronological order - latest first) then it'd be easier to select the proper version - and harder to make mistakes.

My $.02
fields.summary: Released Versions should appear first in the "affects versions" list box

fields.description: JIRA 2.5+ allows the user to switch off selected columns.  If all columns are switched off (by accident?), the result is a gray bar, with no indication of what happened.  We should rather print a "No columns selected" message.
fields.summary: Print a message when no columns are selected

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3111].
  {panel}

Currently, the developer workload report is limited to a single user, and of the form:

Projects   Assigned Issues   Workload
--------   ---------------   --------
ProjA            12           17 days
ProjB            ...            ...

It would be nice if a single _project_ could be chosen, and multiple users' workloads displayed for that project.


User    Assigned Issues   Workload
-----   ---------------   --------
bob          12           17 days
joe          ...            ...
fields.summary: Allow multiple users in User Workload Report

fields.description:
Whether or not a project has a notification scheme, issue events cause notifications to be put on the mail queue.  When these are sent, they cause errors:

2004-02-10 09:15:21,502 ERROR [atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem] There is no default SMTP Mail server so mail cannot be sent

This lazy/nonexistent checking of notification schemes makes the mail queue misleading, as it does not contain "emails which are waiting to be sent out.", but events waiting to be processed that may result in an email.
fields.summary: Notifications that will not be sent are put on the queue

fields.description: Add documentation to say that you need to change the popserver.xml to add a new message handler.
fields.summary: Add Documentation on how to add a new handler.

fields.description:
When moving an issue from one project to another a new key is created for the issue based on the new project.  If you look at the changes history for the issue it will show the ticket going from the old key to the new key.

Please add the fucntionality of being able to search for the ticket by the new and old key.  Currently you are only able to search for the ticket by the new key.  Since the old key is in the change history, please allow to do a ticket search by the old key.
fields.summary: After moving ticket, be able to search by old key

fields.description: a filter to get an overview of my watches like /secure/UserWatches!default.jspa
fields.summary: Add a portlet that displays all (or a configurable number) of the watched or voted for issues.

fields.description: When resolving a jira issue it would be nice with a "next issue" link to quicly go to the next issue assigned to me rather than clicking home and then selecting an issue from the list!
fields.summary: easy next feature

fields.description: I changed the date and time formats under Administration->Look and Feel. These formats are obviously ignored when Jira is sending e-mail, where still the old fashioned am/pm format is used. Can I change that somewhere?
fields.summary: Email notifications don't use customised date&time format
